{"name":"wallet4agent","url":"https/wallet4agent.com","tools":[{"name":"create_agent_identifier_and_wallet","description":"Generate an identifier (DID) for the Agent in the ecosystem and create a new wallet to store Agent attestations as verifiable credentials.","parameters":{"properties":{"admins_identity_provider":{"default":"google","description":"Identity provider for admins","enum":["google","github"],"type":"string"},"admins_login":{"description":"One or more admin login separated by a comma (Google email, Github login ). This login will be needed to accept new attestations offer.","type":"string"},"agent_name":{"description":"Optional agent name. If it exists this name will be used to create the DID of the Agent.","type":"string"},"always_human_in_the_loop":{"default":true,"description":"Always human in the loop","type":"boolean"},"did_method":{"default":"did:web","description":"Optional DID Method, did:web by default","enum":["did:web","did:cheqd"],"type":"string"},"ecosystem_profile":{"default":"DIIP V3","description":"Ecosystem profile","enum":["DIIP V4","DIIP V3","EWC","ARF"],"type":"string"},"mcp_client_authentication":{"default":"Personal Access Token (PAT)","description":"Authentication between MCP client and MCP server for agent. Admins use PAT","enum":["Personal Access Token (PAT)","OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Grant"],"type":"string"},"notification_email":{"description":"This email is used to notify about Agent actions if human in the loop","type":"string"},"publish_unpublish":{"default":false,"description":"Authorize Agent to publish or unpublish attestations","type":"boolean"},"receive_credentials":{"default":true,"description":"Authorize Agent to receive attestations as verifiable credentials","type":"boolean"},"sign":{"default":false,"description":"Authorize Agent to sign message and payload","type":"boolean"}},"required":["admins_identity_provider","admins_login"],"type":"object"}},{"name":"help_wallet4agent","description":"Explain to a human developer how to install and use the Wallet4Agent MCP server with their own agent. Describe at a high level:
- How to install and run the Wallet4Agent MCP server.
- How to configure and use the manifest.json so the agent can discover the MCP server.
- How to connect as a guest, and how to obtain a developer personal access token (PAT).
- How to create a new Agent identifier (DID) and an attached wallet for that Agent, including how the DID document is published and where the wallet endpoint lives.
- How to configure the agent to use that DID and wallet (including storing the PAT safely).
- Basic security best practices for protecting keys, PATs, and the wallet endpoint.

Use this tool whenever a developer asks how to get started with Wallet4Agent, how to create a DID or wallet for an Agent, or how to wire the Agent and wallet together.","parameters":{"properties":{},"type":"object"}}],"resources":[{"name":"Wallet4Agent â€“ Getting Started for Developers","description":"Markdown documentation that explains how to create an agent identity and wallet, use the admin personal access token, and configure authentication (PAT or OAuth 2.0).","uri":"wallet4agent/docs/get_started"}]}
